Award.AwardTitle: Low Dimensional Topology and Heegaard Floer homology
Award.AbstractNarration:
The main theme of this project is the study of knots, three dimensional manifolds, and smooth 4-manifolds. One of the central tools is Heegaard Floer homology that was developed by Peter Ozsvath and the Principal Investigator. The PI studies new applications of these techniques for various surgery problems for three dimensional manifolds, slice knots, and exotic structures on smooth 4-manifolds.The proposal also deals with topological and computational aspects of Heegaard Floer homology. This involves the study of special multiply pointed Heegaard diagrams to build up a topological version of the theory. In a different direction new advances in Heegaard Floer homology are used to study three-manifolds with simple Floer homologies.


The project studies three and four dimensional spaces and central problems in Knot Theory and Low Dimensional Topology. Heegaard Floer homology provides various new tools, such as topological invariants and surgery formulas, for low-dimensional mathematical objects. This theory is closely related to gauge theoretical invariants that originated from interactions between Mathematics and Mathematical Physics. It is expected that advances in Heegaard Floer homology will lead to a better understanding of these gauge theoretical invariants as well.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The project studies three and four dimensional spaces and problems in Knot Theory and Low Dimensional Topology. Heegaard Floer homology and related constructions provide new topological invariants and new tools to study low-dimensional mathematical objects. These constructions are closely related to gauge theoretical invariants.

In a joint work with Ozsvath and Stipsicz, the PI studied the Heegaard Floer homology groups for special families of three-dimensional manifolds. A related research paper constructed and studied lattice homology for knots in certain plumbed 3-manifolds. Other  joint research papers study plumbed three-manifolds that have simple Heegaard Floer homology groups.

In another research direction the PI has constructed a geometric spectral sequence for knots and links in the three dimensional sphere. The construction is closely related to Khovanov homology. In particular, given a planar knot diagram representing a  link, the spectral sequence starts at the Khovanov cube complex of the link diagram, and the higher differentials correspond to certain geometric objects in  the 2 dimensional plane. One of the main results is that the corresponding  graded homology groups give well-defined link invariants. 

In a joint work with Ozsvath and Stipsicz, the PI has also constructed a new one-parameter family of knot homologies. These invariants are used to study smoothly slice knots, and the smooth concordism group for knots. 


Last Modified: 09/24/2015
Modified by: Zoltan Szabo

Other joint research papers study plumbed three-manifolds that have simple Heegaard Floer homology groups. In another research direction the PI has constructed a geometric spectral sequence for knots and links in the three dimensional sphere. The construction is closely related to Khovanov homology. In particular, given a planar knot diagram representing a link, the spectral sequence starts at the Khovanov cube complex of the link diagram, and the higher differentials correspond to certain geometric objects in the 2 dimensional plane. One of the main results is that the corresponding graded homology groups give well-defined link invariants. In a joint work with Ozsvath and Stipsicz, the PI has also constructed a new one-parameter family of knot homologies.
